channel.title: Posts on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on My New Hugo Site

item.description: code builder.put(RESERVED_POOL, new MemoryPool(RESERVED_POOL, config.getMaxQueryMemoryPerNode())); builder.put(SYSTEM_POOL, new MemoryPool(SYSTEM_POOL, systemMemoryConfig.getReservedSystemMemory())); general_pool long maxHeap = Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory(); maxMemory = new DataSize(maxHeap - systemMemoryConfig.getReservedSystemMemory().toBytes(), BYTE); DataSize generalPoolSize = new DataSize(Math.max(0, maxMemory.toBytes() - config.getMaxQueryMemoryPerNode().toBytes()), BYTE); builder.put(GENERAL_POOL, new MemoryPool(GENERAL_POOL, generalPoolSize)); explain RESERVED_POOL = config.properties query.max-memory-per-node SYSTEM_POOL = config.properties resources.reserved-system-memory (default Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory() * 0.4 即 0.4 * Xmx) GENERAL_POOL = Xmx - RESERVED_POOL - SYSTEM_POOL description GENERAL_POOL the memory pool used by the physical operators in a query SYSTEM_POOL mostly used by the exchange buffers and readers/writers RESERVED_POOL for running a large query when the general pool becomes full (only used by one query), 条件 GENERAL_POOL有节点出现阻塞节点（block node）情况，即该node内存不足 RESERVED_POOL没有被使用 action 整体presto给30G内存，requests是30G，limits是32G 可以把reserved_pool分配到5G; system_pool 10G; general_pool 15G 参数设置 yaml limits: 35G requests: 32G config.

arch presto introduction start up by https://blog.openbridge.com/what-is-facebook-presto-presto-database-or-prestodb-a-powerful-sql-query-engine-77d4c4a66d4 forked https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/presto-users/TRwGWf9Z2_o contributions outside facebook 原理 https://tech.meituan.com/2014/06/16/presto.html 审计安全 https://tech.meituan.com/2019/02/14/data-security-platform-construction-practice-jiangjunling.html 关于登陆 统一登陆模块 关于贝佐斯的原则 https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611 All teams will henceforth expose their data and functionality through service interfaces. Teams must communicate with each other through these interfaces. There will be no other form of interprocess communication allowed: no direct linking, no direct reads of another team's data store, no shared-memory model, no back-doors whatsoever.
